content: luggage i d created by crochet&copy luggage i d materials 1 impeccable loops & threads worsted weight yarn color eggplant medium 4 100% acrylic 1 impeccable loops & threads worsted weight yarn color petunia medium 4 100% acrylic crochet hook size 4 00 mm g/6 yarn needle scissors stitch markers stitches/abbreviations chain s = chain s st s = stitch es double_crochet = double_crochet single_crochet = single_crochet treble_crochet = triple treble crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet space s = space s slip_stitch = slip_stitch skip = skip round s = round s repeat = repeat work directions in brackets the number of times specified notes magic_ring = wrap yarn into a ring ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn grip ring and tail between middle finger and thumb insert hook through center of ring yarn over with working yarn and draw up a loop work stitches of the first round in the ring after the first round of stitches are worked pull gently on tail to tighten ring color a yarn = eggplant color b yarn = petunia this pattern was designed as the luggage i d but it can be used for many other projects feel free to adjust to your needs the luggage tag/i d is created using 4 different crochet pieces sewn together measurements approximately 15 long instructions color a yarn flower start with a long tail about 17 row 1 chain 52 1 double_crochet in the 4th chain from hook counts as the first v-shape chain 1 skip 2 chs 1 double_crochet chain 2 1 double_crochet all in the next chain repeat work direction in the brackets 15 times to the end of row total 17 v-shapes row 2 chain 3 turn 9 double_crochet in next chain 2 space 1 single_crochet in next chain 1 space repeat work direction in the brackets to 6 times 7 double_crochet in next chain 2 space 1 single_crochet in next chain 1 space repeat work direction in the brackets 9 times 5 double_crochet in next chain 2 space 1 single_crochet in next chain 1 space 5 double_crochet in last chain 2 space total 17 petals fasten_off assembling flower roll up the flower starting from the smallest petals keep rolling the petals until it shapes out in to a flower using the tail we left earlier begin to stitch the back of the flower together making sure the petals aren t moving too much cover for the back of the flower round 1 color a yarn start with an magic_ring chain 1 doesn t count as a stitch work 6 single_crochet in the ring space do not join work in continuous rounds spiral total of 6 sts round 2 work 2 single_crochet in each st around total of 12 sts round 3 1 single_crochet in next st 2 single_crochet in next st repeat work direction in the brackets around 6 times total 18 sts round 4 1 single_crochet in next 2 sts 2 single_crochet in next st repeat work direction
